Assignment_key3:
`Assignment `operators`` are user to assign values to `variables`.
They ultimately give the value on the right of the `operator` to the `variable` on the left.
Assignment_key5:
This `operator` assigns values to the left hand operand from the right side operand. (This `operator` gives the value of the operand on the right to the operand on the left).
(Operands are values that any `operator` works/operates on).
Assignment_key7: `Add AND `Operator`` adds the value of right operand to the value of left hand operand and then gives the sum (result of addition) to the left operand. Here, `a+=b is the same as a=a+b`.
Assignment_key12: `Subtract AND `Operator`` subtracts the value of the right operand from the left side operand and gives the result to the left operand. Here, `a-=b is the same as a=a-b`.
Assignment_key17: `Multiply AND `Operator`` multiplies the left hand operand with the right hand operand and returns the value as `output`, that is gives the result to the left hand operand. Here, `a*=b is the same as a=a*b`.
Assignment_key22: `Divide AND `Operator`` divides the left hand operand with the right hand operand value and gives the result, that is gives the value to the left hand side operand.Here, `a/=b is the same as a=a/b`.
Assignment_key27: `Modulus AND `Operator`` divides the value of left hand operand with the right hand one and the reminder of this division becomes the new value of the left hand side operand, that is it is given to the left hand side `operator`. Here, `a%=b is the same as a=a%b`.
Assignment_key32: `Exponent `Operator`` gives us the exponentiated value of the left hand operand when raised to the power of the value found on the right hand side. This value is then given to the left hand side operand. Here, `a**=b is the same as a=a**b`.
Assignment_key37: `Floor division` divides the value found in the left hand side with the value of the right hand side operand. The `integer` value becomes the left hand operand value. This means that the `integer` part of the quotient of division is given to the left hand side operand, that is remainder is ignored. Here, `a//=b is the same as a=a//b`.
